Content: Mmm just saw minis at a lot lower power consumption, 260 at base that would make them more efficient.  So the real difference is space taken up,  amount of power supplies .   Ports taken up at the switch etc. Still at this rate might as well go with the minis especially considering coupons.

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content:
@polycryptoblog Something else I just thought of:
Since Bitmain has yet to release any specifics on the Z9 (to actually compare with the minis), it's key to accept the possibility that we're all merely assuming that they are 12 chips per card and thus 4x but they could actually be 10 chip cards that are already punched up to a higher frequency.

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content: From a manufacturing and business sense, the latter would be far more profitable for them to do.

Author: FishyGuts#5085
Content:
Important things being equal, cost, power consumption 
One Z9 breaks, you lose 100% of your hashpower.
One Mini breaks and you lose 25% of your hashpower.

Plus, does anyone know if you can use more than one coupon per unit?   If not, then you can use 1,000 worth of coupons on 4 minis.

Author: jonske1#5173
Content: Hi. New to kmd. Was there a fork recently?

Author: jonske1#5173
Content: Trying to find info.

Author: BlackJesus#6161
Content: We forked I think in March for the elections

Author: BlackJesus#6161
Content: Notary nodes are hard coded into the chain

Author: BlackJesus#6161
Content: Komodo forks annually, sometimes more than once a year but atleast once per year

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: There is another hard fork at block 1 million

Author: BlackJesus#6161
Content: That's all the interest changes right an do are they activating bigchaindb at 1 million?

Author: BlackJesus#6161
Content: Nixing the free for all period and making the chain more miner friendly although notaries will still rule.

Author: BlackJesus#6161
Content: @blackjok3r

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Yes free for all is removed and *rewards* is changed to monthly instead of yearly

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Free for all is no longer required as notaries wont mine if GPU percentage is uner 25%

Author: BlackJesus#6161
Content: Is the smart contract code being merged as well?

Author: BlackJesus#6161
Content: I know that's going to require a hard fork.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Those are already in komodod, if you use the ac_cc=x parameter.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: But if you start it with that, it will hard fork into another chain

Author: BlackJesus#6161
Content: Ok

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: we wont activate CC in KMD until it is very well tested in the other chains, likely next year's new notary hardfork
